titlestmt.titleproper: Finding Aid for the Laurence Binyon Papers LSC.0404
titlestmt.author: Finding aid prepared by Brooke Whiting, June 1959; machine-readable finding aid created by Caroline Cubé.

address.addressline: Room A1713, Charles E. Young Research Library

profiledesc.creation: This finding aid was produced using ArchivesSpace on 2022-09-13 15:58:03 -0700.

did.abstract: Laurence Binyon (1869-1943) was a British Museum official for 40 years as well as a art historian, critic, translator, playwright, and poet. The collection consists of 7 versions of Binyon's play, Arthur, which was composed by Binyon in 1923 in collaboration with Sir John Martin-Harvey. There is also a folder of notes about Arthur, a folder of notes and sketches for the production by Martin-Harvey, 16 original drawings of costumes by M.L. Blood, and 61 letters to Martin-Harvey.
did.physloc: Stored off-site. All requests to access special collections material must be made in advance using the request button located on this page.

accessrestrict.head: Restrictions on Access
accessrestrict.p: Open for research. All requests to access special collections materials must be made in advance using the request button located on this page.

userestrict.head: Restrictions on Use and Reproduction
userestrict.p: Property rights to the physical objects belong to UCLA Library Special Collections. All other rights, including copyright, are retained by the creators and their heirs. It is the responsibility of the researcher to determine who holds the copyright and pursue the copyright owner or his or her heir for permission to publish where The UC Regents do not hold the copyright.

prefercite.head: Preferred Citation
prefercite.p: [Identification of item], Laurence Binyon Papers (Collection 404). UCLA Library Special Collections, Charles E. Young Research Library, University of California, Los Angeles.

processinfo.head: Processing Information
processinfo.p: Collections are processed to a variety of levels depending on the work necessary to make them usable, their perceived user interest and research value, availability of staff and resources, and competing priorities. Library Special Collections provides a standard level of preservation and access for all collections and, when time and resources permit, conducts more intensive processing. These materials have been arranged and described according to national and local standards and best practices.

We are committed to providing ethical, inclusive, and anti-racist description of the materials we steward, and to remediating existing description of our materials that contains language that may be offensive or cause harm. We invite you to submit feedback about how our collections are described, and how they could be described more accurately, by filling out the form located on our website: Report Potentially Offensive Description in Library Special Collections.

bioghist.head: Biography
bioghist.p: Binyon was born August 10, 1869 in Lancaster, England; British Museum official for 40 years, as well as art historian, critic, translator, playwright, and poet; author of numerous works on art, including Painting in the Far East (1908); professor of poetry at Harvard; published many collections of poetry, including The winnowing fan: poems on the Great War (1914), The sirens (1924), The idols (1928), and Collected poems of Lawrence Binyon (1931); wrote a play, Arthur (1923), whose original title was "Launcelot"; died in March 1943 in Reading, England.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Content
scopecontent.p: Collection consists of 7 versions of Binyon's play, Arthur, which was composed by Binyon in 1923 in collaboration with Sir John Martin-Harvey. Also contains a folder of notes about Arthur, a folder of notes and sketches for the production by Martin-Harvey, 16 original drawings of costumes by M.L. Blood, and 61 letters to Martin-Harvey, several of which are addressed to Lady Martin-Harvey.

p.emph: Description derived from in-house card files.

did.physdesc: 7 versions. Holograph (original version in 7 notebooks, 20 × 16 cm.), and 6 typescripts with corrections by Binyon and Sir John Martin-Harvey.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note

list.item: A play in 8 scenes, composed by Binyon in close cooperation with Martin-harvey.
First published by William Heinemann, London 1923.
First produced by Robert Atkins at the Old Vic, March 1923.

scopecontent.p:
Also, 2 folders of related materials:
Miscellaneous notes about Arthur by Binyon and Martin-Harvey
Notes and sketches for the production of Arthur by Martin-Harvey.

did.unittitle: Costumes [by M.L. Blood] for the play on "King Arthur." Sutton Coldfield.
did.physdesc: 16 original drawings, one to a page, numbered 1 through 17. no.15 is missing. 4 are watercolors. Bound in wrappers.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: With this: invoice for drawings from M.L. Blood to Mrs. Martin Harvey for £3-3-0. Sutton Coldfield, November 30, 1912.

did.unittitle: Letters, signed, to Sir John Martin-Harvey. v.p.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: The bulk of these letters have to do with the writing of Arthur, 1913-1923. Several of them are addressed to Lady Martin-Harvey.
